column1: When disabling City, Country, State/Province, Zip/Postal Code, please keep in mind that shopping cart will also be affected since those attributes are used in estimations and calculations.
column2: When disabling City, Country, State/Province, Zip/Postal Code, please keep in mind that shopping cart will also be affected since those attributes are used in estimations and calculations.

column1: We kindly pay your attention that the configuration on the Store View scope has its nuances. Changes of the fields' status made for a specific Store View will be reflected on the storefront for this Store View only. However, it won’t change the status of the updated fields in the Magento configuration (Stores > Configuration > Customers > Customer Configuration) for Website and Global scopes.
column2: We kindly pay your attention that the configuration on the Store View scope has its nuances. Changes of the fields' status made for a specific Store View will be reflected on the storefront for this Store View only. However, it won’t change the status of the updated fields in the Magento configuration (Stores > Configuration > Customers > Customer Configuration) for Website and Global scopes.

column2: Select ‘Automatically’ to trigger an update of Order Summary automatically after the quantity or product options are changed.

column1: Enable JS and HTML bundling and minifying for checkout page
column2: Enable JS and HTML bundling and minifying for checkout page

column1: Up to 30% faster checkout page load time and up to twice smaller bandwidth consumption due to reduced resources size.
column2: Up to 30% faster checkout page load time and up to twice smaller bandwidth consumption due to reduced resources size.

column1: How it works: the concept is similar to caching. Initially, checkout page starts loading with bundling disabled, but as soon as all files are loaded, all js and html files get minified and merged into one, so that the next time the page loads faster.
column2: How it works: the concept is similar to caching. Initially, checkout page starts loading with bundling disabled, but as soon as all files are loaded, all js and html files get minified and merged into one, so that the next time the page loads faster.

Some fonts use extra parameters e.g. Molle:400i where 400 = regular, i = Italic (100 = thin, 700 = bold)
